data.title: Great Authentic Food
data.text: This restaurant is a family run intimate trip to another world. The portions are large, the service is good and the kitchen is open so you can see your food being made. It's not fancy but real and delicious. Definitely worth a trip! Space is limited,so call ahead if you have more than 4.

data.title: Spectacular food
data.text: Amazing find, really spectacular food. Group of 8 and everyone raved about the food. Definitely recomend

data.title: Wonderful!
data.text: I took my 18 year old son and 15 year old daughter here. I had no idea what it would be like...turned out to be a highlight of the trip. Totally wonderful. I assume that it was the owner who greeted us when we arrived -- so warm and welcoming. The food and atmosphere was terrific. I'll definitely go again next time I'm in Schenectady.

data.title: Amazing!
data.text: Our son treated us to his favorite restaurant in the area and we loved it!  very inventive menu and friendly staff in a atmospheric ( but tiny) space.  A+

data.title: Best Moroccan outside of Marrakech!
data.text: Just dined at Tara Kitchen with our daughter and her friend with parents at Union parents weekend. On advice of local friends, the 6 of us arrived at 5:00 as they were opening and were so thrilled to get a table (they don't take reservations).  By 5:45 it was full, although tables turned all night so give it a try. We haven't had such delicious and authentic Moroccan food since a fabulous vacation in Marrakech. Every combination of flavor you can imagine in a tagine. Make sure to try some spreads and the fluffy soft fresh pita triangles. We loved the tapenade and the spicy harissa. No dessert (didn't have the baklava tonight) but loved the warm mint tea with honey to start and the Moroccan wines. Also no splitting the check (Venmo to the rescue).  I can't recommend this highly enough. The owner's family was lovely and service top notch. Can't wait to go back!

data.title: Awesome  food
data.text: Awesome food  great service Very cozy atmosphere   We will be returning again and again. The baklava is worth the trip just for it.

data.title: Wish this was MY local gem!
data.text: Yes, we were in the neighborhood. We knew nothing about Moroccan food so our food choice was based on past reviews and the staff recommendation. So, we ordered 3 app (eggplant, tapenade and something our 15 yr old picked) and 2 tagines (lamb with pomegranate and molasses and fish which was also  the 15 yr old's choice). They were all excellent and wished we could take the left-over home. It was a long drive so we decided to sit around just so that we can wipe the plates clean:)  Also, the staff were exceptional, attentive and helpful. We love this family restaurant!

data.title: I think I'm a regular now
data.text:
It's nice to walk in to a restaurant you've been in maybe 3 or 4 times before and get greeted by name. Yes, I've had some electronic interface with the proprietor regarding her on-line recipes and cooking videos, so I wasn't just a walk-in face. Still, it's nice.

We were fortunate to be able to get an outside table on the deck; we won't get that for another 8 months. 

We new from experience we wanted the Warm Fig Salad appetizer. It's made with honey, harissa and white beans. We talked about getting a triple order and calling it a main dish. (Instead, we tried duplicating it at home and adding lamb; it worked, but we have to fine tune the proportions). My wife had the cauliflower/apricot/potato/black olive tagine, as I had put cauliflower in her mind a week earlier. The cauli/potato blend we usually associate with Indian Aloo Gobi, but this was differently spiced, of course. I enjoyed the mixed vegetables with figs in spicy date sauce, since this past summer I discovered fresh (not dried) figs and have been figging out every chance I get. This was my second or third go-around with the spicy date sauce, so next time I'll find something else.  

Service was excellent as usual and the food has us yearning to go back, after we've tried some more on our own.

data.title: Excellent food; so-so atmosphere
data.text: This restaurant lived up to its reputation for food and unique presentation! However, there is room for improvement on the overall experience. The place was busy when we arrived and we were seated toward the front of the restaurant, near the bar. The atmosphere in this area left a lot to be desired. Inventory was being delivered and unpacked in front of us. Paperwork and laptop activities were taking place at the bar. The staff was talking amongst themselves as if the patrons were not even present. The focus was certainly not on ensuring we felt like welcomed guests!

data.title: Delicious and cozy
data.text: Small but cozy place - smells good the second you walk in. The host answered any and all questions about the food - was very hospitable . The food was excellent - I had a stew my wife had a couscous Tagine meal - presentation and service were great.

data.title: Food is very good, service lacking
data.text: We enjoyed a good meal while in town visiting Union College. However, the kitchen seemed confused. The wrong meal showed up and was then fixed. Then our second meal showed up and we questioned if it was correct. They assured us it was but the ingredients were wrong. We finally convinced them and they soon arrived with the correct order. The warm pita is nice but when you ask for seconds it takes a while for them to appear. If the service was more accurate, the experience would be much better

data.title: Best of Schnectady
data.text: By the far the best Morroccan food I've ever had. You can't go wrong with anything here we tried several different dishes and all were amazing!

data.title: So delicious!!
data.text: My husband and 2yo son visited this restaurant based on the incredible reviews on here. We were not disappointed! The waitress had great recommendations for us since we never had Moroccan food before. I had the lamb meatballs which were incredible and my husband had the chicken with spicy prune sauce and raisins. My son ate both dishes and was very happy. We also ordered the eggplant appetizer which was incredible. So happy we gave this place a try!

data.title: great atmosphere, friendly service, excellent food
data.text: The restaurant is so cute and cozy.  I love the colorful ,tile decor when you walk in.  The staff are all so friendly, and attentive.  Make sure you start with the eggplant dip with naan.  It's out of this world!  The menu has so many great options for all type eaters.  I'm a frequent flyer for lunch :)

data.title: Authentic Moroccan Food
data.text: Authentic Moroccan Food, great atmosphere if not a bit cozy and a really nice patio if you choose to eat outside. They also have cooking classes "You will learn how to use a tagine and make your very own Moroccan lunch! We provide all of the equipment and ingredients for this interactive class.  You will also leave with a gift bag." Wonderful addition to the downtown Schenectady scene.

data.title: Ignored
data.text: The first time I went to Tara Kitchen I was the only one there and they had just opened.  They were so happy to have a customer that they were all over me.  What a difference from my second time.  I never got to eat because I was totally ignored.   The place was busy and I took what looked like the last table available which was near the bar.  The bartender saw me.  He knew I was there.  The waitresses came in and out of the room and saw me sitting there and never acknowledged me at all.  I know it was busy, but a nod of recognition or someone saying "I'll be right with you" or something.  I sat there for over 20 minutes while the staff just looked at me sitting there.  I thought maybe a middle eastern restaurant didn't want to serve an "unaccompanied" woman or something.  I felt unwanted and totally ignored so I left..

data.title: Great Moroccan food
data.text: Reasonable food great quality home cooked food. Generous portions, reasonably priced. Parking just a few steps away in a city owned lot. You won't be disappointed.

data.title: Delicious!
data.text: Hard to choose from the menu, so many great choices but you can't go wrong. Vegetarians and carnivores will find happiness here.

user_location.name: Saratoga Springs, New York, United States

data.title: Wonderful fare, be ready for some heat
data.text: We celebrated our anniversary here last week and it was a great foodie experience. A huge eggplant fan, I was delighted to hear that the owner's nickname was "Eggplant Queen"! The eggplant, tomato appetizer was DELISH as was the eggplant, prune and chickpea tangine. Everything was piping hot. This place will be cozy in the cold winter months. On a day where the heat index went to 100 degrees, it was a little warm at the table!

data.title: Delicious food, BYOB
data.text: You either need to arrive by 6:15 to score one if the three indoor tables for four or wait for the first group to turnover. We found each dish more delicious than the next although the lamb meatballs are spectacular. The wine is limited to Moroccan offerings, which had too much of an etholonol flavor for our tastes. The service is friendly and all dishes are flavorful.
